newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-RBA's Macfarlane says wage ruling helps rates.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-RBA's Macfarlane says wage ruling helps rates.

text.p: Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) governor Ian Macfarlane said on Thursday that the recent wages ruling by the national labour tribunal had helped remove one barrier to achieving lower interest rates.

"A possible hurdle to lower interest rates was removed when the Industrial Relations Commission released its decision on wages," Macfarlane told a federal parliamentary committee in an opening statement.

The Industrial Relations Commission last month awarded a A$10 a week pay rise to low-paid workers, a decision which was interpreted by credit markets as not threatening the central bank's low inflation target.

Macfarlane also said that the full effects of the three easings in monetary policy in calendar 1996 had yet to flow through. The official cash rate now stands at 6.0 percent as a result of the three easings of 50 basis points each.
Earlier, in its full semi-annual statement on monetary policy, the RBA said that current cash rate levels were accommodating the pickup in the economy without prejudicing inflation.
